listutils

Class ListUtility

  • java.lang.Object
    • listutils.ListUtility

  • public class ListUtility
extends Object
    Library for generic list utilities
    Version:
    1.4.0

    • Method Detail

      • flatten

        public static <T,R> List<R> flatten(List<T> list)
        Returns a new flattened List.

        For every element that is an array or List, extract its elements into the new List. This is repeated until the final output is a 1-dimensional List.

        Note that, due to Java's implementation of generics, arrays of primitives will ultimately result in a List containing an array.

        Type Parameters:
        T - Generic input class identifier
        R - Generic return class identifier
        Parameters:
        list - Input list
        Returns:
        Flattened list
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • flatten

        public static <T,R> List<R> flatten(List<T> list,
                                    int level)
        Returns a new flattened List.

        For every element that is an array or List, extract its elements into the new List. Recursion is limited to level iterations.

        Note that, due to Java's implementation of generics, arrays of primitives will ultimately result in a List containing an array, given a high enough level.

        Type Parameters:
        T - Generic input class identifier
        R - Generic return class identifier
        Parameters:
        list - Input list
        level - Level of recursion to flatten
        Returns:
        Flattened list
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • flatten

        public static <T,R> List<R> flatten(T[] list)
        Returns a new flattened List.

        For every element that is an array or List, extract its elements into the new List. This is repeated until the final output is a 1-dimensional List.

        Note that, due to Java's implementation of generics, arrays of primitives will ultimately result in a List containing an array.

        Type Parameters:
        T - Generic input class identifier
        R - Generic return class identifier
        Parameters:
        list - Input array
        Returns:
        Flattened list
        Since:
        1.1.0

      • flatten

        public static <T,R> List<R> flatten(T[] list,
                                    int level)
        Returns a new flattened List.

        For every element that is an array or List, extract its elements into the new List. Recursion is limited to level iterations.

        Note that, due to Java's implementation of generics, arrays of primitives will ultimately result in a List containing an array, given a high enough level.

        Type Parameters:
        T - Generic input class identifier
        R - Generic return class identifier
        Parameters:
        list - Input array
        level - Level of recursion to flatten
        Returns:
        Flattened list
        Since:
        1.1.0

      • ensureSize

        public static void ensureSize(ArrayList<?> list,
                              int size)
        Ensures the size of list is at least size.

        If the list size is less than required, null is appended until the values are equal.

        Note that it is considered best practice to use interfaces over implementations of those interfaces where possible, but in cases where an ArrayList must be used, this version can be faster.

        Parameters:
        list - List to be resized
        size - Required size
        Since:
        1.2.0

      • ensureSize

        public static void ensureSize(List<?> list,
                              int size)
        Ensures the size of list is at least size.

        If the list size is less than required, null is appended until the values are equal.

        Parameters:
        list - List to be resized
        size - Required size
        Since:
        1.2.0

      • transpose

        public static <T,R> List<R> transpose(List<T> original)
        Returns an n-dimensional List that is the matrix transposition on the input List.

        Given an i-by-j List, transpose it to a j-by-i List.

        Type Parameters:
        T - Generic input class identifier
        R - Generic return class identifier
        Parameters:
        original - Input list
        Returns:
        Transposed list
        Since:
        1.4.0

        Type Parameters:

        R - Generic return class identifier
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        Transposed list
        Since:
